form.name: form1

div.span: Following Governor Beshear's recommendation, MCPS schools will remain closed to in-person instruction for the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year. We will continue to utilize NTI days for the rest of the semester.

li.a: Family Resource and Youth Services Centers

img.alt: Little boy playing with building blocks

li.a: Family Resource and Youth Services Centers

td.a: McCracken County High School Student Awarded Prestigious National Honor Society Scholarship

br.span: The National Honor Society (NHS) announced that Carley Beatty a high school senior at McCracken County High School and member of the NHS, has been selected as an NHS Scholarship semifinalist.

td.a: MCHS Senior Lauren Ervin Earns Top FCCLA Honors

br.span: McCracken County High School Senior Lauren Ervin will start college in the fall with an impressive number of Family and Consumer Sciences honors and scholarships under her belt.

td.a: Heath Elementary School Teacher Achieves National Board Certification
MCHS Students Selected for the Gatton Academy of Mathematics and Science

br.span: The Gatton Academy of Mathematics and Science in Kentucky has selected 102 Kentucky sophomores for the Class of 2022 including two from McCracken County High School.

a.title: Location: Board of Education Starting at: 5:30 PM
Location: Board of Education Starting at: 5:30 PM

td.a: McCracken County High School Student Awarded Prestigious National Honor Society Scholarship

br.span: The National Honor Society (NHS) announced that Carley Beatty a high school senior at McCracken County High School and member of the NHS, has been selected as an NHS Scholarship semifinalist.

td.a: MCHS Senior Lauren Ervin Earns Top FCCLA Honors

br.span: McCracken County High School Senior Lauren Ervin will start college in the fall with an impressive number of Family and Consumer Sciences honors and scholarships under her belt.

td.a: Heath Elementary School Teacher Achieves National Board Certification
MCHS Students Selected for the Gatton Academy of Mathematics and Science

br.span: The Gatton Academy of Mathematics and Science in Kentucky has selected 102 Kentucky sophomores for the Class of 2022 including two from McCracken County High School.

td.a: MCHS and RMS Nationally Recognized for Commitment to Music Education

br.span: Only two Kentucky schools made the NAMM Foundation’s 2020 list of SupportMusic Merit Award winners, and both are right here in McCracken County: McCracken County High School, and Reidland Middle School.

td.a: McCracken County High School Student Named Technical Center Student of Year

br.span:
Travis Priddle is working toward graduation. He is working through graduation, and it looks like he will be working after graduation.
That is the work ethic that the 29 Associated General Contractors of Western Kentucky Technical Center Students of the Week all shared, and Priddle — the first Student of the Week for the 2019-20 school year — was chosen as the region’s Technical Center Student of the Year.

td.a: McCracken Regional School Recognized for Exemplary Work

br.span: In an effort to recognize the work of educators and programs that serve students with a variety of learning needs, the Kentucky Department of Education (KDE) has named 11 Alternative Programs of Distinction. The programs will be recognized at the Kentucky Board of Education’s regular meeting in June.

td.a: Mustang Media Students Earn Multiple WKU Mark of Excellence Awards

br.span: Despite the cancellation of ceremonies due to COVID-19, Western Kentucky University found a way to recognize outstanding high school journalists, including those from McCracken County High School.

div.style: float:left; width:100%; text-align:center; text-transform:uppercase; font-weight:900; font-size:18px;

div.div:
As required by law, the District does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, genetic information, disability, age, or limitations related to pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions in its programs and activities and provides equal access to its facilities to the Boy Scouts and other designated youth groups.
Notice of the name, work address and telephone number of the Title IX Coordinator and the Section 504 Coordinator for the District shall be provided to employees, applicants for employment, students, parents/guardians, and other beneficiaries such as participants in activities offered to the public.

tr.td:

Paducah, KY 42003
